page.title: 07THE ORIEL SWORD
page.content: The Oriel Sword is a two handed sword, it is 1.68m long including a leather covered hilt with a wrought steel cross guard as well, probably of the C16th (1500's). About 15cm of the sword were engraved with a bit of decoration. There were three words in Latin saying:"FIGHT FOR THE NATION".And a coat of arms in initials of "R.D." with a date of l423, and some wavy lines too. Swainswick village belonged to Oriel College Estate. Richard Dudley gave Swainswick Manor to Oriel College. In l870 Mr Richard Shackell, a tenant, kept the sword preserved in the Manor Farm for many years. Then it was carried in local processions to the church for the thanksgiving service of the recovery of the Prince of Wales (Edward VII). In l902 it was taken to Oriel College.Bath City keep duplicate
